metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6082 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Including port 22 in the list of allowed FTP ports in Networking in Google Chrome prior to 65.0.3325.146 allowed a remote attacker to potentially enumerate internal host services via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6082` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1').
